description:
Next generation photogrammetry software for professional drone and terrestrial mapping


1.86.0
Additional Updates and Improvements
- The “Process in PIX4Dcloud” workflow now uses the current coordinates from the camera table, enabling the processing of images where geolocation was imported (e.g., via CSV) or modified
- Added undo/redo support for vertex placement when drawing geometries and ortho patches in the 2D view
- Unified the behavior of the Esc and Enter keys across all 2D creation tools (ROI, orthomosaic patches, polylines, and polygons) and selection modes
- Coordinates in the status bar now display the elevation at the hovered location in both display and project CRS units
- Views in the custom report now preserve the original projection mode (perspective or orthographic)
- Automatic tie points (ATPs) are no longer affected by Terrain or ASPRS class coloring and visibility settings
Information
- Small GeoTIFF files are exported again in a standard TIFF format compatible with mainstream viewers.
Bug fixes
- Fixed an issue where a backup file created by a newer version of the software was incorrectly deleted when opening the project in an older version
- Fixed an issue where invalid coordinate or orientation accuracies were not replaced by default values when importing OPF or PIX4Dmapper projects
- Fixed an issue where importing image geolocation reset the position accuracy to default values if the imported file did not contain accuracy data
- Fixed an issue where orthomosaic patches could be misplaced in certain cases when the orthomosaic was generated using a region of interest
- Fixed an issue where measurement labels in the 2D view did not update when changing the display unit
- Fixed an issue where the region of interest (ROI) interfered with drawing polylines in the 2D view
- Fixed the color of the polygon preview in the 2D view when the active layer is hidden
- Fixed an issue where the DSM was hidden and displayed incorrect elevations when reopening projects with non-metric units
- Fixed an issue where “Process in PIX4Dcloud” incorrectly geolocated projects using left-handed coordinate systems
- Fixed an issue where the column format in the import dialogs did not consistently update to reflect the selected columns
- Increased the size of the scale constraint input field to accommodate up to 6 digits
- Fixed an issue that caused LAS and XYZ point cloud exports to be empty when filtering by an ASPRS class
- Fixed an issue where the image viewer did not correctly sort images to show those with marks on top when selecting a marker
- Fixed an issue that prevented inserting a vertex on a polyline edge between two vertex tie points (VTPs) in the 2D view
- Improved the logic for the auto-selection of point cloud inputs in the processing panel to prevent invalid configurations when applying templates
- Fixed an issue where the progress bar would run from 0% to 100% twice during DSM creation when using automatic tie points (ATPs) as the input
- Fixed an issue where uncalibrated cameras were not correctly displayed as input cameras after removing the project calibration
- Fixed an issue where moving a polygon between layers could result in duplicate polygon names
- Fixed an issue related to the minimum and maximum values in the exported DSM, which made it incompatible with some third-party software.
- Fixed an issue where non-fatal internal errors could cause the densification process to fail
- Fixed a crash that could occur during mesh generation when estimating the point cloud scale
- Fixed an issue where PIX4Dcloud project links, generated after sharing or processing, would not open a web browser

Version 1.85
Version Release date Release Type Installers
1.85.0 November 11, 2025 Preview Windows Mac
Disclaimer: The preview version contains new features and bug fixes. Documentation and support are not available. We recommend testing the preview version before using it for production work.
1.85.0
New Capabilities
- Added a new dialog to select both the organization and license type after logging in
- Custom ASPRS classes can now have their id set manually
- The orthomosaic generation now respects the region of interest (ROI), allowing the orthomosaic area to be restricted without regenerating the DSM
- Added an “Ortho mode” button to the section view toolbar to easily toggle 90-degree angle vectorization
- Added Ukrainian as an available language
Additional Updates and Improvements
- Split processing options in the processing panel, moving advanced settings under a new "More options" button
- Updated the processing option logic in the PIX4Dcloud "Process" tab:
  - The "PIX4Dcatch" option is now disabled for drone-only projects
  - Mixed (drone + PIX4Dcatch) projects now default to "Nadir" and display a warning, as this combination is not officially supported. The "Oblique" and "PIX4Dcatch" options remain enabled
- Added a validation to block project uploads to PIX4Dcloud if the horizontal and vertical CRS units do not match
- Improved the mesh generation to avoid gaps between adjacent tiles
- Improved the mesh generation for merged projects to better handle varying point cloud densities
- Made several improvements to the orthomosaic editor:
  - The visibility of patch borders can now be controlled independently from the patch content
  - Patches are now always rendered as flat horizontal polygons in the image viewer
- Added an option to export the orthomosaic without transparency to improve compatibility with third-party software
- Updated the drag-and-drop behavior for folders: project files (e.g., .opf) are now detected and opened directly, which also allows for opening multiple projects in one operation
- Improved camera support:
  - Added more robust focal length reading from EXIF data
  - Included support for Skydio-specific GPS accuracy
  - Refined minimum GPS accuracy for DJI cameras
- Updated project calibration behavior to properly integrate GCPs for georeferencing when input DJI RTK imagery is tagged with too-high geotag accuracies
- Added new menu options to the ASPRS class panel to toggle class visibility, switch between RGB/monochrome view, and remove classification
- Polygon vertex tie-points are now rendered in the 2D view
- The quality report now correctly displays the DSM interpolation strategy
- Added support for two new geoid models:
  - Norway/Svalbard: Svalbard_EGG2015_2024
  - Netherlands/Bonaire: BONGEO2004
- Changed the "Add keyframe" shortcut to Ctrl+K
- Updated the user account menu: "Organizations" is now "Organizations & licenses", "Licenses" is now "Plan and licenses", and icons were added for external links
- Improved the error message when trying to re-upload to a project with a different CRS
Bug fixes
- Fixed a crash that could occur when exporting an orthomosaic with large empty regions into multiple tiles
- Fixed an issue where DSM generation could get stuck or crash when using the “Expand area” option if all point cloud points were above the cameras
- Fixed an issue that prevented users from entering certain characters in the custom report input fields
- Fixed an issue where the sky background would flicker in orthographic mode
- Fixed several issues related to mesh generation:
  - Corrected an issue that could cause the surface to be trimmed too aggressively in datasets with very different point cloud densities
  - Addressed a rare issue where the mesh generation algorithm could spend considerable time estimating the point cloud density
  - Resolved an issue that caused long processing times during mesh generation for non-axis-aligned corridor projects
